data.name: About_CreditsText
data.value: Alt Controller uses some free icons from the Silk icon set 1.3 by Mark James, which is available from www.famfamfam.com/lab/icons/silk/ and is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 2.5 License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5). The installer was packaged using NSIS (http://nsis.sourceforge.net).

data.name: About_LicenceText1
data.value: Alt Controller is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

data.name: About_LicenceText2
data.value: Alt Controller is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details.

data.name: About_LicenceText3
data.value: You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with Alt Controller. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/.

data.name: About_ProgramDescription
data.value: A program to help make computer games more accessible. Alt Controller maps computer inputs, such as pointer movements and button presses, to actions, such as key presses.

data.name: About_SpecialEffect
data.value: Alt Controller was developed as a volunteer project for SpecialEffect, a fantastic charity that helps disabled people to enjoy computer games. If you like this program, please consider making a donation to them.

data.name: Action_RepeatDirectionalInfoLabel
data.value: Visual representation of % of time the key is held for (black = 100%, white = 0%):

data.name: Action_RepeatInfoLabel
data.value: To repeat the key presses indefinitely while this action is active, set 'Stop after' to zero

data.name: Action_RepeatScrollInfoLabel
data.value: To scroll indefinitely while this action is active, set 'Stop after' to zero

data.name: Inputs_IntroLabel
data.value: Add the inputs you wish to control your computer with. You can use the mouse pointer, the keyboard, or your own custom windows containing buttons.

data.name: Log_IntroLabel
data.value: Use the 'Start' and 'Stop' buttons to record information about the actions Alt Controller is performing. This may be useful for testing profiles and diagnosing problems.

data.name: Main_FileSaveAsToolTip
data.value: Choose a file to save the current profile to

data.name: Main_HelpEventLogToolTip
data.value: Record information about inputs and actions as they occur

data.name: Main_ToolsOptionsToolTip
data.value: Edit options which apply to all profiles

data.name: Main_ViewDrawStateOverlayToolTip
data.value: Show mode and page name overlay

data.name: Main_ViewProfileNotesToolTip
data.value: View and edit notes for the current profile

data.name: Main_ViewProfileSummaryToolTip
data.value: View a summary of the current profile's inputs and actions

data.name: Notes_IntroLabel
data.value: Here you can enter any notes or instructions for this profile.

data.name: Options_ResetToolTip
data.value: Resets all options to their default values

data.name: Profile_SeriesRadioButtonToolTip
data.value: Perform actions one at a time

data.name: Regions_BrowseRegionImageToolTip
data.value: Choose a background image for this region

data.name: Regions_BrowseScreenshotToolTip
data.value: Choose a screenshot of your desktop or application

data.name: Regions_ClearRegionImageToolTip
data.value: Clear the background image for this region

data.name: Regions_DrawToolTip
data.value: Enable drawing using click and drag

data.name: Regions_ForceSquareToolTip
data.value: Force drawing of square areas (ignore Y-axis)

data.name: Regions_IntroLabel
data.value: Here you can define regions of the screen to use as mouse pointer controls. Click and drag to draw or move regions, or use the sliders. Hold down Control and click to select multiple regions. You may find setting a background image (screenshot) helpful.

data.name: Situations_AppsIntroLabel
data.value: Apps are the programs you want to use Alt Controller with. When you switch to a program defined here, Alt Controller automatically applies the controls for it.

data.name: Situations_ModesIntroLabel
data.value: Modes allow you to create different controls for different situations or tasks. You use 'Change mode' actions to switch between them.

data.name: Situations_PagesIntroLabel
data.value: Pages are like 'sub-modes'. When you change the current page, the controls for the current mode and app still apply, but any controls for the page take precedence.

data.name: Situations_RefreshButton
data.value: Refresh the list of running programs

data.name: Situations_SnoozeLabel
data.value: Snooze profile when using this app

data.name: Situations_SnoozeToolTip
data.value: Don't perform any actions while this app is active

data.name: String_Actions_defined
data.value: This input has some actions defined for this situation

data.name: String_Add_action_error_description
data.value: Unable to create an action - check that that you have entered valid values for all the settings

data.name: String_Add_keyboard_error_description
data.value: Can't create input - only 1 keyboard allowed

data.name: String_Add_mouse_error_description
data.value: Can't create input - only 1 mouse allowed

data.name: String_Choose_folder_description
data.value: Choose the folder in which to store your {0} profiles

data.name: String_CompatibilityLabel
data.value: Provided for compatibility with previous versions

data.name: String_Duplicate_app_description
data.value: Please ensure that no apps have been added more than once

data.name: String_Duplicate_regions_description
data.value: Two or more identical regions are exactly on top of each other. Are you sure you want to close anyway?

data.name: String_Inherits_actions
data.value: This input has some actions defined for a parent situation

data.name: String_Reset_options_description
data.value: Reset all options to their default values?
